tit.e: Ko-no-Zu (lines used as a pattern of artistic work in Kodo)
tit.cmt: カッコ部分を補いました。
tit.e: Ko-no-Zu (lines used as a pattern of artistic work in Kodo)

sen.j: 香の図（こうのず）は、香道の中で、ある種の組香（くみこう）、もしくは芸術品の紋様として利用される縦線と横線からなる図柄である。
sen.e: Ko-no-Zu is a kind of Kumiko or a design consisting of longitudinal and horizontal lines used as a pattern of artistic work in Kodo.
Ko-no-Zu is a kind of Kumiko or a design consisting of longitudinal and horizontal lines used as a pattern of artistic work in Kodo.
Ko-no-Zu is a kind of Kumiko or a design consisting of longitudinal and horizontal lines used as a pattern of artistic work in Kodo.

sen.j: 主として、源氏香（げんじこう）・系図香（けいずこう）・三種香（さんしゅこう）という組香に用いられる。
sen.e: Ko-no-Zu is mainly used in Kumiko of Genjiko, Keizuko, and Sanshuko.
Ko-no-Zu is mainly used in Kumiko of Genjiko, Keizuko, and Sanshuko.
Ko-no-Zu is mainly used in Kumiko of Genjiko, Keizuko, and Sanshuko.

sen.j: 源氏香の図は縦5本の線を基本として構成される。
sen.e: Genjiko-no-Zu is basically configured as five longitudinal lines.
Genjiko-no-Zu is basically configured as five longitudinal lines.
Genjiko-no-Zu is basically configured as five longitudinal lines.

sen.j: 各線の示す香りは、右から第1香、第2香、…、第5香の順と決まっている。
sen.e: The scent that each line shows is determined as the first scent, the second scent,..., and the fifth scent in turn from the right.
The scents these lines show, determined from the right hand side, as the first scent, the second scent,..., and the fifth scent.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: The scents these lines show, determined from the right hand side, as the first scent, the second scent,..., and the fifth scent.

sen.j: 香道組香において、5つの香りを聞いた後、同香だと思ったものの頭を横線でつなぐことで源氏香の図が表現される。
sen.e: In Kodo Kumiko, Genjiko-no-Zu is expressed by smelling five scents and then linking the heads of the longitudinal lines with a horizontal line that seem to be the same scents.
In Kodo Kumiko, Genjiko-no-Zu is expressed by smelling five scents and then linking the heads of the longitudinal lines that seem to be the same scents with horizontal lines
sen.cmt: a horizontal line→horizontal lines と修正しました。（縦の線を繋ぐのは一本の線だけではないので）文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: In Kodo Kumiko, Genjiko-no-Zu is expressed by smelling five scents and then linking the heads of the longitudinal lines that seem to be the same scents with horizontal lines

sen.j: たとえば、2番目の香と5番目の香が同じで、他は全て異なる香であると思ったら、藤袴になる。
sen.e: For example, when the second scent seems to be the same as the fifth scent and the others all to be different, the Genjiko-no-Zu is Fujibakama (Thoroughwort Flowers.)
For example, when the second scent seems to be the same as the fifth scent and the others all to be different, the Genjiko-no-Zu is Fujibakama (Thoroughwort Flowers).

sen.e: For example, when the second scent seems to be the same as the fifth scent and the others all to be different, the Genjiko-no-Zu is Fujibakama (Thoroughwort Flowers).

sen.j: 全部で52通りのつなぎ方がある。
sen.e: There are 52 ways in all to link the lines.

sen.j: 源氏物語全54帖のうち、桐壺と夢の浮橋の2帖を除く52帖の巻名が一つ一つの図に附されている。
sen.e: 52 quires except two quires of Kiritsubo and Yume no Ukihashi from 54 quires in the Tale of Genji are each referred to the Kono-Zu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 詳しいルールに関しては、香道源氏香の源氏香の欄も参照されたい（源氏香の詳しいルール等については、香道組香を参照されたい）。

sen.j: 源氏香の図は、その芸術性の高さからか、着物やそのの帯、重箱等の模様、家紋としてもよく使われている。
sen.e: Genjiko-no-Zu is often used as designs of kimono or the obi and Jyubako or a family crest, maybe from high quality of its artistry.
Genjiko-no-Zu is often used as the designs of kimono or obi and Jyubako or a family crest, due to the high quality of its artistry.

sen.e: Genjiko-no-Zu is often used as the designs of kimono or obi and Jyubako or a family crest, due to the high quality of its artistry.

sen.j: また、和菓子においてもこれを模しているものが存在する。
sen.e: Some Wagasi (Japanese confectionery) imitates this Genjiko-no-Zu.

sen.j: 系図香の図は、縦4本の線を基本として構成される。
sen.e: Keizuko-no-Zu is basically configured as four longitudinal lines.

sen.j: 源氏香より香数の1つ少ない系図香に利用され、源氏香の図と同様に、同香と思ったものの頭をつなぐことで完成する。
sen.e: It is used in Keizuko that has one few scents than Genjiko, and expressed by linking the heads of the longitudinal lines with a horizontal line that seem to be the same scents, which rule is similar to the Genjiko.

sen.j: 源氏香より2つ、系図香より1つ香数の少ない三種香に利用され、源氏香、系図香と同様に、同香の頭をつなぐことで完成する。
sen.e: It is used in Sanshuko that has two few scents than Genjiko and one few scent than Keizuko, and expressed by linking the heads of the longitudinal lines with a horizontal line that seem to be the same scents, which rule is similar to the Genjiko and Keizuko.
